website_summaries.verdict: A simple, gentle wipe good for most sensitive skin types.
pros: Consumers say that these wipes are non-irritating, clean well, and don't tear
They also stand out for being very moist and having limited ingredients to reduce the risk of irritation
cons: A few felt they were too expensive
some felt they were thinner or more coarse than other wipes

customer_reviews.title: Tiny thin wipes...  Not worth the frustration!
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea but the wipes are WAY too small and slippery to do anything. I'm not even exaggerating... It took me about 10-15 wipes to clean a poop because of how ridiculously thin they were. I now have a case and only use these wipes for pee or for wiping hands. The honest ones are only a little better and i think I'll just stick to the costco ones, which can clean a poop with only 2 or 3 wipes. It cuts down on waste and frustration. I really wanted to use these because of cleaner ingredients but it's just really not worth the anger i feel when trying to use these 😬
customer_reviews.author: happy kitty

customer_reviews.title: Possibly fake, thin wipes
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT the same water wipes. As you can see in my photo the wipes I received are so thin they are see through and they are not even the same size! Water wipes were already smaller than regular wipes and these are even smaller! I’m pretty sure these are fake. That or water wipes have cheaper out and made their wipes thinner and smaller, if that’s the case I won’t be buying them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel Winton

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I loved these wipes!! I don't know what exactly was in one of the packages of wipes (look at pictures) it was sticky and rough. ...I would give a better rating and buy again if this didn't happen! Waterwipes contacted me and explained what happened. They are sending me replacements. I am grateful they are mking this right.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not Original water wipes. Super rough and not even the same size/texture of the water wipes that I had sampled (view picture sample is the smaller package on the left with the baby picture). Truly disappointed. Will not be using amazon to buy these wipes again. Second picture is the label stating they are different wipes. Keep in mind you don’t know that until you receive your package 🤦🏻‍♀️ SCAM!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is it a counterfeit?
customer_reviews.text: We have been purchasing Water Wipes from Amazon for a while now. However the last package we received had scent and the texture of it was totally different. So it raised the question if it’s a counterfeit product or not. Would love to hear if anyone had similar issues. Otherwise it was a great product to use with your baby.
customer_reviews.author: hb

customer_reviews.title: Good for hands. Not good for butts.
customer_reviews.text: I want to like these wipes. They are so pure and great for little hands and little faces in addition to tiny tushies. But they are just so dang difficult to use! They are nearly impossible to get out of the package with one hand, which is critical when you are desperately trying to keep the aforementioned little hands away from a dirty tiny tushie. Also, they just don't wipe that well. They're almost too smooth to effectively wipe the baby poop, especially the sticky meconium during the first few days. I wouldn't recommend these, unless you're just using them for post-meal clean up on the go.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Great product, packaging could be improved
customer_reviews.text: So glad that a friend recommended these to me! They are great for sensitive skin. Baby had a yeast diaper rash for a week while I battled with thrush, and the grapefruit seed extract was something that was recommended to aid in recovery. Knocking off one star on a great product because the packaging stinks. Inevitably it rips and I have to store it in a ziplock bag the rest of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Britt C.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Thin, poorly packaged, and not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a sensitive bum so after lots of online searches as to what we can do to prevent or treat rashes, I decided to try these wipes after many recommendations. They're certainly pricier than other wipes, but I'm willing to pay more to help her not get a rash! However, these wipes are thin and the packaging is awful. You pull one out, another comes with. The opening is bad. We often have to use 3 wipes on one change. We have better luck with other well known "sensitive" brands. I've bought two cases of these, but won't buy any more.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: THEY CHANGED - Much thinner, less wet now
customer_reviews.text: So unfortunate because these were our absolute favorite baby wipes. We could use ONE of these instead of 3-4 Pampers sensitive wipes to do the job! Since we last purchased, the mfg has COMPLETELY changed the texture of the wipe: they are thinner, waffle textured and dryer. Originals were super thick, very very wet. I hope they return back to the original! especially since its the same cost
customer_reviews.author: Dong-Hyeon Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Like others have mentioned, the wipes have changed. I noticed the dots on the newer wipes that I just received recently. The ones that I got in the beginning of the year was just plain rather than having the “dots”. Sheets at the top tend to be dryer but if you just flip it for a bit prior to opening the liquid should even out. This is probably just due to the way it’s stored. It doesn’t always pull out perfectly either. Sometimes I have to stick the extra sheets back in and the sticker doesn’t always close properly/stay close. Regardless, these are just minor issues to me. I still like how there are very minimal ingredients used.
customer_reviews.author: Mengyi

customer_reviews.title: The only wipes I can use for my baby’s sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I first bought these wipes in store and needed more so decided to order through amazon. I was a little worried because of some of the reviews saying they’re fake or different quality. I have only been using these for a short while but the wipes I received from amazon are the same quality and ingredients as the ones I purchased in a store. The packaging of these wipes does kind of suck because the sticky flap doesn’t really stay shut but I bought a wipe holder to fix that. These are the only wipes my baby hasn’t had a reaction to so I will continue to repurchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sonora Tillman

customer_reviews.title: these are just ok
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why these wipes had such amazingb reviews! Ok they are gentle that's great but they don't clean very well!! The best wipes are the Costco Kirkland ones- gentle, large and have texted to pick up the stuck on poop lol! I was really hoping these were great .
customer_reviews.author: Blue Cat

customer_reviews.title: Meh, not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: For the first couple months we were using these. We thought what could be better than just using plain water to clean our infant? Well we ran out and we had a trial pack of pampers wipes in our hospital bag. Let me tell you, there is a big difference. In order from worst to best we have found Parents Choice from Walmart to be the worst (they’re really bad), these water wipes, then Huggies (only because of their lack of a decent closure, gets dry), then Pampers.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for gentle skin
customer_reviews.text: These are perfectly gentle, do not trigger any rash like the main competitor wipes. I love that they are save on gentle skin. If I could change one thing it would be how the wipes are folded together for packaging. Sometimes one wipe comes out, sometimes four come out of the package. It is a little frustrating when you only have one hand to work with, need one wipe, and up to four come out when you try to get just one. I have a subscription because they are the best I've found safe for gentle skin.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Really great if you have a sensitive skin baby. We use these and huggies sensitive skin wipes both are great brands. These water wipes are a little more expensive but worth it for baby’s sensitive skin. We can’t use Charmin or Pampers as it tends to break our baby out. But these two brands we have noticed he doesn’t have an issue with.
customer_reviews.author: Jennaluv247

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I do not like these wipes at all. They are not put into the bag so that one will come out after another instead youre left struggling to try abd get each wipe out. Which if you're struggling with your toddler to change his/her diaper you don't want to be struggling with wipes too. I understand these are called water wipes but they are soaking wet. These wipes were bought in desperation during the pandemic as someone with twin babies I didnt want to run out. Will not be buying these ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlee Lindorff

customer_reviews.title: The best and “cleanest” wipes ever
customer_reviews.text: I use wipes every single day, as have both of my children. One day I was listening to Howard Stern and he was explaining why he doesn’t use typical baby wipes because you’re essentially inserting tons of chemicals and perfumes (or even without perfumes, chemicals for sure) into your rectum daily. This made complete sense and can’t be good for you in any way, so these wipes do everything wipes are supposed to do without shoving dangerous chemicals into your or your families’ anus and risking problems in the future
customer_reviews.author: GDP

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for flushable adult wipes
customer_reviews.text: I use these as a replacement for flushable adult wet wipes because they are significantly more cost-effective. They certainly do the job. They aren't as "smooth" feeling as adult flushable ones & not as thick, but they work for the intended purpose just fine. The adhesive plastic flap is also good, too. I've kept a few open ones in a number of bathrooms for at least over a month, and none of them are close to being dried out. I've also used these to help clean my dog's ears, face & paws and they work great for that, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: We absolutely love these wipes for their lack of chemicals
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love these wipes for their lack of chemicals. They clean baby really well and don't cause any problems for his skin. Unfortunately, any other wipe, no matter how "sensitive," causes problems for him. We had bought a bunch of free and clear Seventh Generation, and we've tried the sensitive versions of Pampers and Huggies, but they all caused baby's skin to react poorly. The only reason I dropped a star is for how poorly they feed. It's impossible to get out one at a time, and invariably the last 3-5 in the package come out as one clump. I gladly accept the waste since these work for baby, though.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Wife

customer_reviews.title: Triple price, difficult to get out, poor cleaning
customer_reviews.text: These are noble in what they aim to achieve. I support the idea. They are poorly designed/folded and as a result getting them out of the bag is a huge pain. Not what you need with lil kicker is covered in poo. They clean OK but not as well as a traditional wipe. I’m going back to amazon brand. I can’t justify the 3x cost for a wipe that works 1/3 as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I love that there is nothing nasty in them (no chemicals
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of these until a friend brought a pack of them to the hospital when I had my son. I love that there is nothing nasty in them (no chemicals, fragrance, preservatives) so they double up as boogie and face wipes for the diaper bag (who doesn't love multi tasking baby items?). Love these so much I never tried any other wipes which I've heard can be greasy or have ingredients you can't pronounce. Added bonus that they stay really moist in the diaper bag even though the package doesn't have a good seal. At home, I just use them with a wipe dispenser. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Not continuous feed
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I would have realized if I looked into it more but I wanted to get these because they were “free and clear”. My husband has Eczema so we want to be careful with baby. But they don’t continuously feed so they don’t work in dispensers. I’ve dealt with it for the first 4 months of my baby’s life because we bought so much. But I don’t plan on reordering. Very sad about it too : ( They just aren’t worth the annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: TaylorTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wipes! Too small.
customer_reviews.text: Water wipes are FABULOUS. They are super filled with --- I guess water. But they are not dry like other wipes. They work soo well. They're natural. I love them. EXCEPT!!! The wipe is soooo small. Like what the hell? I'd give it 5 stars but they're so tiny. If they were a normal sized wipe, you'd need a quarter of the wipes that you normally, but because of the size, i end up using the same amount anyway. It's aggravating to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: Truly the best. My baby has very sensitive skin, and these are the only wipes he does well with. Because it’s 99.9% water and a drop of fruit extract, I feel safe to use it even on his face. From newborn to ~2.5 months of age, my baby had wet farts that required constant wiping and washing. These were very wet wipes, so it helped the gentleness factor. Only gripe I have about this is that the sheets kind of stick together sometimes. I don’t have much of a problem with this, but my husband will sometimes grab a few at a time accidentally, which I think is a rather wasteful. The price is worth it for my baby!
customer_reviews.author: Libby Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes ever! So pure!
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are absolutely amazing! I received a pack as a gift for my little one and I couldn’t believe how pure they were and how much better they feel on her. They are pretty much like water! No harsh chemicals and no burning down down there. I can’t believe I didn’t buy these sooner. Since using them she hasn’t had a single rash, and she would get rashes a lot. These are truly amazing and worth the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: I am definitely buying these again!
customer_reviews.text: When the pandemic started to rise, I said I better order some wipes (I live in a remote village so ordering on line is like going to the store) I had to keep scrolling till I found available wipes, because for like three pages of scrolling most bulk wipes were "currently unavailable" so I had to keep scrolling. So I stumble upon these water wipes. And I just love them! They are so soft, I would actually prefer these over huggies or Pampers.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenda

customer_reviews.title: Not great for extra cost
customer_reviews.text: I want to like these because they don’t have a chemical cocktail in them, but they are too wet. It takes so many of them to clean poop because the excessive wetness makes them just slide over the mess instead of wiping it up. I switched to Babyganics and they work so much better. Not a fan of the long ingredient list, but they are still pretty clean, especially when compared to main brands out there.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad S.

customer_reviews.title: Must-have daily tissues
customer_reviews.text: We tried to switch to cloth at home but our daughter refused that... This tissue makes me feel safe due to it's water-only ingredients. Very soft. I use it every day, every meal both at home or outside to wipe my daughter's mouth and hands.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Say yes to water wipes
customer_reviews.text: We used these with our first and now with our second. Both are sensitive (other brands would give them rashes, i didn’t like the scents, etc.). With our second we tried the Kirkland hyper allergenic wipes but they too were too strong (I tested them out on myself on my face and redness ensued everywhere). These are totally worth it. Avoid the rashes and redness and just buy and subscribe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only wipes we'll use for our baby
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I would ever care about what wipes I used, but after starting with these and trying others there's just no comparison. These are light, just wet enough, and don't have any strong smells or other unnecessary chemicals in them. Yes, they are a little expensive for what they are which is why I gave them 4 stars, but we've been very happy with them and will probably only use this brand for our child.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: perfect for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I purchased these wipes! I received a bunch of different brands of wipes at my baby shower but decided to buy these myself after hearing so many good things about them and I’m so glad I did. We’ve tried a few different kinds that we were gifted and these are the only ones that don’t irritate her. There is no scent, they’re very soft and stay moist in the wipe-warmer we use. We will be sticking to these from now on and I can definitely recommend them to other parents with babies who have sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Darby

customer_reviews.title: Moldy damaged boxes
customer_reviews.text: I am a subscriber to these wipes on amazon for convenience. I like the wipes and the ingredients . After several months of deliveries I got a moldy damaged box. I was on the fence about what to do since I didn’t know if the wipes inside would be useable but I returned the box because I didn’t want to risk wiping mold on my baby. I was really surprised when a few months later I got another moldy damaged box. I don’t understand how people are not checking for this before shipping. It’s gross and after looking over the reviews on here I see I’m not the only one this happened to.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great for diaper rash
customer_reviews.text: I first ordered these during COVID-19 lock-down because I couldn't get the wipes we normally use and I will never go back to my old wipes. My son dealt with ongoing diaper rash. Creams would help but it never completely went away. After a few days of using these wipes, his diaper rash was completely gone. I still use cream occasionally, but for the most part it's a thing of the past. These wipes are great for babies with sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Sharpy

customer_reviews.title: Honestly the best wipes. I was purchasing medical grade ones that ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best wipes. I was purchasing medical grade ones that you add water to, just like the ones I used in the hospital when baby was born. This is the same, with the water already added in a convenient pack. No rashes, no stinging, And they don't dry out at all. Wish they had these when my other two were in diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Aimers

customer_reviews.title: Worth the splurge
customer_reviews.text: These are the best wipes for newborn skin. It’s worth all the rave and hype. I used this exclusively for my daughter uNail she was about 7 months. Now that she’s a bit older, her skin is better able to tolerate cheaper wipes. But as a newborn, when I tried to switch to something cheaper (pampers sensitive) it gave her a diaper rash. So I say this is definitely worth the splurge on delicate newborn/infant skin.
customer_reviews.author: B. Duong

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: They didn’t come in a sealed box but in a sealed bag which I guess doesn’t matter. The individual packages are skinny I don’t remember them looking like that but I guess that doesn’t matter either. The wipes are good, no fragrance and super wet like they are suppose to be. Good product and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Abree

customer_reviews.title: Good, but expensive
customer_reviews.text: I am comparing these wipes to the other brands I have tried: Pampers sensitive, Huggies natural, Seventh generation, Honest -- Soft, moist -- Size smaller than others -- Pricier than the others -- The wipes can be hard to pull out of the package -- The top several wipes were too dry, I even tried storing the package upside down an it didn't make a difference -- Packaging does not have that nice flip top Overall, if you're willing to pay premium this is a nice product, but I find the Huggies natural is comparable for half the price
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Best wipe yet, but uneven wettness
customer_reviews.text: These do seem to be the most natural wipes I've used yet and way better than the others for preventing diaper rash. My only complaint is the top ones are dry and the bottom ones are too wet. You really have to store them upside down and squeeze the package a lot to redistribute the water evenly. Hence a reduction in stars for that. The flap cover is also only okay.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: They do not clean
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I don’t use water wipes for my babies. I purchased these because they were the soonest available. Now, not having the need for sensitive wipes, I find these to be terrible. The wipes in the top half of the package were dry; the bottom, moistened, but even the moistened do not clean. They just move the soil around on the baby’s skin, without absorbing or removing it.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Agudo Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our family likes ordering our bigger grocery list items from amazon prime. And we love water wipes! They are a great product that you don’t have to worry about what chemicals you’re putting on your baby. We use them on his face to clean up after meals with no worry. Recently switched to honest company wipes for their bundle and save package but still have water wipes in the house just in case we need them. Would totally recommend to anyone with small children. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Leena

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: With the shortage of any cleaning products during the COVID-19 pandemic, I decided to make my own bleach and lysol wipes. Very easy to do. These wipes are soaked in water and no other chemicals leaving them ready to soak up whatever you want to use: bleach or lysol. Much more durable for cleaning and wiping surfaces, keeping them sanitary and free of germs and viruses.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T.

customer_reviews.title: These Wipes Have Changed
customer_reviews.text: The first time I ordered these I loved them! Idk what’s going on now but I had to switch baby wipes because these wipes have changed from the original ones I got the first time. They have become smaller and rougher in texture. I realized I was using more than 2 wipes each time I did a diaper change and started to get concerned about how rough they felt again my babies bottom. (Did not want to impair his delicate skin) Switched to honest wipes, softer thicker, larger, chemical free also and around the same price.
customer_reviews.author: J.W

customer_reviews.title: Only wipes my daughter can use
customer_reviews.text: A bit expensive, but would highly recommend. We tried other brands just to try to save money and in the two years we always keep coming back because our daughter seems to have reaction to every brand out there. Very thankful for this product! Without it we would constantly have to use diaper cream on rashes given by other brands out there
customer_reviews.author: Donna Toler

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, but no good wipe warmer option
customer_reviews.text: We use these for our 1 year old daughter. We like them because they are great for sensitive skin and the water wipes feel more hygienic than dry wipes. The only problem is that we haven't found a good warmer that we can also use with these wipes. So getting them out of the warmer and changing her diaper can be a challenge, especially because she is so squirmy. They should really sell a warmer too.
customer_reviews.author: KalEl

customer_reviews.title: I don't think I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: The carton packaging that arrived this time was broken again. It was the same last time. I don’t understand how this happens every time I buy this wipe. It never happened when I bought it from the others. Although the individual packaging inside is complete but the babies' things always make me feel uneasy. I don't think I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best Wipes You Will Ever Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best of the best. They get all the dirty stuff off the bum!! Definitely buying again and again. The best way i could describe them is like a pampers wipe but has way more wetness. It's softener than any wipes i've tried and i've tried almost every store bought brand. If you want something soft, hypoallergenic, doesn't smell, or doesn't dry out, get WATER WIPES!! I hope my internet enthusiasm has made you buy these... You won't regret it (:
customer_reviews.author: Courtny

customer_reviews.title: Especially good for newborns
customer_reviews.text: Newborn skin is SO sensitive. I took home the water wipes from the hospital and everything was good. I tried regular brands’ sensitive wipes and they gave her a diaper rash. I purchased a pack of these after finding a small pack to try at Target and my baby and her bum were very happy. They work wonderfully well and are so gentle. She’s older now so I use both these and other wipes I was given at my baby shower. Give them a try especially for your newborn...or give them as a gift at a baby shower. All will be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Phaithe Reyes-Leonti

customer_reviews.title: The latest batch of wipes—for which I paid the same ...
customer_reviews.text: The latest batch of wipes—for which I paid the same price—are nearly 10% smaller in size. The old wipes were 6.9 x 7.7 inches while the new ones are 6.4 x 7.3 inches. They even went as far as switching the order of the dimensions on the packaging so that the new wipes say 7.3 x 6.4, presumably hoping that you'll only look at the first number. I don't appreciate being ripped off and so I won't be buying these anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Beasi

customer_reviews.title: Only thing I use on my baby.
customer_reviews.text: I love these for my baby. She has very sensitive skin and I don't like to use a lot of chemicals. They do a great job of clearing her up and they never irritate her. I find the wipe itself is soft for her but durable enough to get the job done well. I buy them all the time by the case. I love them as they are also a nice back up/replacement for any other wipes in the diaper bag. I encourage all parents to buy the best you can for baby as they will most likely pick your nursing home.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting
customer_reviews.text: These suck. Whether you it them in a warmer or leave them in the package they come in .. they aren’t east to get out. They come out one at a time instead of how other wipes are kinda connected ~enough to at least get a few in a hurry. Also they are soaking wet like super gross . I have to squeeze some of the water out Endor spitting in on her or everything is wet... disgusting. The packs are skinny and just so not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: 🤙

customer_reviews.title: Great, gentle wipes
customer_reviews.text: These are great. It is the only kind of wipe that we can trust to not have a bunch of added chemicals, and the only wipe that doesn't give my baby a rash. We use just cloth with water to clean him when it's just urine, but we use water wipes when he poops or if we are out. I never have to worry about it not cleaning him well. I'm so glad my midwife told us about these, and glad there are still products made that just contain the basics.
customer_reviews.author: TheMushroomMan

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: no strong scent, wipes are very wet so you do not need to rub a lot (great for when baby has a rash), has never caused irritation. Cons: The package does not have a flip top, but a sticker tab. Usually by the end of the pack, we have completely ripped the tab off and torn some of the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Forenn V Carr

customer_reviews.title: Great wipe
customer_reviews.text: My last three children I used nothing but pampers sensitive, but just recently my youngest 15 month old kept getting rashes and would scream when we used the wipes. I went out and bought a bunch of small packages wipes to try out and stumbled on the water wipes. They solved the problem and I bought a case. They were delivered quickly and I do use them in wipe warmer adding a bit more water than usual and they seem to be fine so far. They don't dispense well and are a bit small but they are worth having my baby not in pain.
customer_reviews.author: LinaP

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Wipes
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are water. We have been using it for over a year now and we love it. Our kid has never had any skin issues with these wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Deepak Bansal

customer_reviews.title: Gentle on skin but....
customer_reviews.text: We switched to these wipes after our 1 yr old daughter had some anal fissures from severe constipation. I thought using these would be more gentle. While I do think it's less irritating to the skin, the wipes are incredibly thin, super hard to separate out of the packages, and so slippery it's hard to clean her bottom. I end up using 4-5 wipes sometimes instead of the 1-2 I would normally use, because it just doesn't get the poo off. I bought a case of these, and now that her constipation is better, I can't wait to get back to using regular wipes
customer_reviews.author: NAT

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Omg I love these wipes! At first I used the pampers for sensitive skin... and one day... I wiped my vagina with it and it burn! So I started research these products like a and woman and would buy the sample at a local store and would always first apply any product I put on my baby either in my skin or eyes. I put these wipes on my eyes and it didn’t burn or nothing. I am now subscribed. It’s silly to think I buy wipes with water but they come in handy and the material is soft and it just has water. :)
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing wipes without horrible scent and chemicals
customer_reviews.text: Never understood the hype before...now I get it! These are amazing. No nasty smells, no harmful chemicals on my baby’s skin! Never thought they could be affordable but you honestly need less than the crappy wipes as they are thick, soft, and durable. With amazon family and adding items I buy anyway to subscribe and save they are definitely affordable!
customer_reviews.author: R Jung

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea
customer_reviews.text: There's a cult following for these wipes. Especially with the whole chemical-free clean concept. I like the idea, but when you have a screaming baby and time is of the essence, these wipes could be packed in a better way so that when you grab a sheet, you end up pulling like a chunk of 6 sheets at a time and they just go to waste. So for expensive wipes, I actually waste more than I should at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: Used to love these, but quality for recent batches have gone down
customer_reviews.text: We used to only use these wipes, but the recent batches we have been getting the quality is not as good as it used to be. The wipes are definitely thinner and not as gentle as before. And because these wipes are more expensive and no longer the same quality, we have switched over to seventh generation wipes, which are nice quality wipes and cheaper too!
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: They are fantastic, do not smell like anything
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these since my baby was born. They are fantastic, do not smell like anything, and they are very wet! I have never had any mold problems like some other people have said, and I order them about once a month. Great price when buying a bigger box, and I seriously use them for everything and I love that they only have 2 ingredients!!!
customer_reviews.author: ilovedogsandbabies

customer_reviews.title: SO helpful buying in bulk...and love these wipes, especially for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Of course, buying in bulk is helpful always having wipes when we need them. But my daughter would get a bad rash using other wipes because of all the chemicals in them. So we always use these wipes and it does a great clean up, on bums, faces, hands. It has more moisture to them then other wipes so i feel that i actually get a better clean and use a little bit less wipes then normal.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Y.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is great for my baby’s bottom!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great for my baby’s bottom! She has super sensitive skin and reacts to a lot of other “sensitive skin” or “organic” products, but not this one! Only thing is some shipments have been less moist than others. Maybe a bad/old batch? This order seemed like the sheets were slightly updated; has little circles (better for removing stuff) versus the other one which was a plain smooth sheet. Either way this stuff is great!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Yeah wipes
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get this thank god after everyone going crazy to the stores and left everyone else without food diapers and wipes super essential when you have babies I like them they are wet so the clean is easy has a little sense like fruity but hasn’t bother my kids skin
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was having really bad diaper rash, so I wanted to switch wipes to see it it would help. The rash cleared in a couple day after using water wipes. I love that I can use them for her face and hands too without it leaving a residue. The wipes are thin and smooth (other wipes are thick and cloth-like) and they stay moist. They’re definitely worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: ben jones

customer_reviews.title: More expensive but had no choice, baby needed wipes
customer_reviews.text: Paid more than expected but baby needed wipes and they were the only ones left on Amazon, I usually buy buggies wipes.
customer_reviews.author: heather millswood

customer_reviews.title: Wipes ok, but bad package design
customer_reviews.text: These wipes do what they are intended, but they are difficult to get out of the package because you can't find the end, so sometimes you get more than one, and the closure on the package stops adhering after about a dozen wipes. Have to keep it upside down to keep it closed.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Soft and practical
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, soft, and keep people and things clean. We can't use the wipes with aloe due to allergies, so these are a great alternative. We have bought them before and will continue to purchase in the future. They stay intact and are easy to use. The resealable package stays sealed use-after-use; a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: amazonkat

customer_reviews.title: So happy to have an alternative to all those chemically treated ...
customer_reviews.text: So happy to have an alternative to all those chemically treated wipes out there! Like any wipe, they will mold after awhile, but guess what? So do the ones with chemicals in them. I've never received a package with mold but know that if you open it and don't use it up (like any other wipe out there,) it will eventually mold. It's not a problem for us since we always use them up in a month ish.
customer_reviews.author: 40 something CA country boy

customer_reviews.title: Must have, the best for babies with sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Got these since baby kept getting rash. After switching to these wipes,bordeaux butt paste and burts bees diaper rash cream it all went away. These wipes have been amazing, no scent, clean great, and do not irritate or dry out swing. We will not use another brand!
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Vera

customer_reviews.title: tricky, tricky!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it claimed to be all natural and have nothing but water and a bit of fruit extract. WELL, read the package and you will find that is not true. Under the ingredients list it says "Contains trace of Benzalkonium". Also, I found out the actual wipe is synthetic rather than plant based like other brands. This company is really tricky and I am not happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: Marion

customer_reviews.title: Best Wipes!
customer_reviews.text: I initially received a single use sample in the mail (not amazon) and I loved it! They are unscented, slick and the packaging is so convenient. The sealing plastic flap is stiff and seals back every time even if the surface is a tad bit wet. I bought this for my sister for her newborn and she loves them for her sensitive skin, no more rashes and doesn't need as much ointment since she dries up right away, it's just water! But with a great consistency.
customer_reviews.author: nelly

customer_reviews.title: Usable for all ages
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are not just for babies. They are good for anyone who would like a soft moist wipe for other problems. All ages would benefit from these.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I am not certain if these are knock-off Waterwipes or not. We received Waterwipes as a gift for our NB and we loved them so much (compared to a few others that were gifted) that we bought another case. We still have plenty of other gifted wipes but still wanted these. Lo and behold, the Waterwipes purchased on Amazon are smaller, dryer, and have a very different texture to them. So far we have not come across any issues with them effecting our baby but we are still on the first pack out of the box. Will update a few packs in.
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: My baby has eczema, and overall pretty sensitive skin. We have been using these since day 1. I have never worried with these, for wiping his hands/face or diapies. In binds we've had to use Pampers or another brand, which lead us to a red bottom. Uh oh. But these...these are the best. Great to buy in bulk and give a pack as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: K Bos

customer_reviews.title: Not real water wipes
customer_reviews.text: These are not real water wipes they gave my son a rash . I’ve used water wipes since he was born and he’s never had a rash. Very disappointed. Buy the ones from target or buy buy baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Yes, they’re knock offs.
customer_reviews.text: These are not Water Wipes. The wipes are smaller, rougher (true Water Wipes do not have any texture) and a looot drier. I won’t be purchasing from these Amazon again - so disappointing because they’re expensive and truly the best when they’re ya know, real Water Wipes. Now I just have 10 packs of super expensive extremely average wipes to go through. Thanks, seller! :/
customer_reviews.author: ariana

customer_reviews.title: Contains Chemical found in household cleaners!!
customer_reviews.text: 🚨 Not chemical free 🚨 Contains trace of Benzalkonium Chloride Biocide, preservative and surfactant associated with severe skin, eye, and respiratory irritation and allergies, benzalkonium chloride is a sensitizer especially dangerous for people with asthma or skin conditions such as eczema. Benzalkonium chloride is found in many household disinfectants and cleaning supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Woo2011

customer_reviews.title: My favorite wipes!
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are great if your little one has sensitive skin, and even if they don’t! I had been using all the different brands of wipes o received at my baby shower and my little one ended up with a diaper rash. I immediately switched to these (plus gave her a bath and let her air out!) and her rash was almost completely gone the next day. Plus they are comparable in price to other wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Long

customer_reviews.title: THA BEST
customer_reviews.text: When dads start to favor products you know it's good. Our son has sensitive skin and these are perfect: no harsh smells or chemicals. We tried using other water-based wipes but these still take the cake. They are the perfect size, wetness and material.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Made my son's butt turn red raw with pain!
customer_reviews.text: We've mainly used Kirkland brand wipes but due to Covid we haven't been able to get any so I thought I'd try these since they're more natural. My son has never had sensitive skin or any issues with his bum, but after using these for not even a week his bum was red raw and he was crying every time he needed a diaper change. We stopped using them and bought Honest wipes since we still couldn't get a hold of his usual brand and his bum is now okay.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Lochrie

customer_reviews.title: Best Wipes On The Market
customer_reviews.text: Like my daughter and husband, my 6 month old grandson has eczema and extremely sensitive skin. These are the only wipes that don’t cause a reaction. We use them for diaper changes and to clean his skin and hands. They are moist and nicely sized.
customer_reviews.author: Yolunda

customer_reviews.title: 5 star product
customer_reviews.text: Great baby wipes, I have tried to use them as make up wipes too and these were the only ones that were soft enough for my eye area. Let's take Pampers pure wipes for example, those were very rough for my face, so I bet babies are also not as happy to feel them on their skin.
customer_reviews.author: VYTAUTAS  ATKOCAITIS

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I regret buying these. They have too much water, are difficult to pull out of the package because they stick to each other like wet glue, and are impossible to hold well while wiping. However, these wipes are exactly what the box says they are so I gave two stars instead of one.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Pagonis

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but hard to pull out
customer_reviews.text: I love how natural these wipes are! As a first time parent using wipes, I discovered that these are probably the wettest wipes you'll ever encounter.. there's leftover water in the bag even after we're done using them. Also, maybe because of the wetness, it's difficult to pull out each wipe on its own. The sheets tend to get stuck and I have to use both hands to pull out and separate, which can be inconvenient when you're changing a diaper and only have 1 free hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jess CTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is my first time using these with my second baby. I noticed his skin was sensitive and he was getting diaper rashes pretty easily, so I wanted to try these water wipes. They are so great! Not irritating to his skin and work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I love these wipes. They are great cause my son has eczema and these wipe don't flare the irritation. They are also great cause I use them all over his body including his face so don't have to worry about chemicals staying on his skin or rinsing them the wipes out before use so the scent is not too strong. The only con about this product it that it does not come out of the packaging easily you sometimes have to dig to get the wipes out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: I love that these wipes are sensitive for baby and use mostly water. However, my husband was not a fan of them. Because they are almost entirely water, they leave our son pretty wet after we use them and that extra moisture has led to rashes. They also do not help with smell reduction, which matters as well and helps keep our son clean and smelling nice. It may simply be preference.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get out
customer_reviews.text: I love the way these wipes clean up and that they are so pure but, getting them out is awful. You either can't even get one or you get 74 and with a crying newborn, it's no fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kara Russell

customer_reviews.title: HappyBooty
customer_reviews.text: WaterWipes are THE BEST baby wipe out there. PERIOD. They’re so soft, absorbent, strong, I scented and they DO NOT dry out—even in the wipe warmer—which means you don’t waste wipes because of dry ones in the stack. Please don’t waste your hard-earned money on anything else. WaterWipes or bust!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Best.  Wipes.  EVER.
customer_reviews.text: I buy these in bulk and they are worth every penny. Absolutely no oily residues or fragrance, and the thin, simple sheets do a surprisingly good job cleaning up. Wipes stay moist. We use them to clean everything that the baby uses. My baby has sensitive skin and has been irritated from other "natural" wipes. No rashes or irritation at all (I use with Honest diapers). I always give a box of these as a gift at baby showers, and anyone I've given them to has gotten hooked. LOVE THESE WIPES!
customer_reviews.author: HopeStew

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are very dry, and the texture is very rough on baby skin. I use this brand all the time and never had an issue in the past. It seems like it’s an old batch I received. The wipes are useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t really matter BUT these are not easy to pull apart. You have to spend some time unfolding each wipe. That being said, these are lovely. I can use them on every inch of my baby without having to worry about irritating his skin, I can’t say that about other wipes!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Brown

customer_reviews.title: Safe for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: It does not have a strong scent and is very effective ...though I would love it more if it was thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Good product but packaging is a struggle
customer_reviews.text: These are great! The only negative is how they stick together so badly. You can’t easily pull out one after another, you end up getting a huge pile that you have to shove back in. Otherwise the product is good for sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So soft and there is no strange smell like some other wipes
customer_reviews.text: So soft and there is no strange smell like some other wipes. But sometimes it is hard to take out one wipe and 2-3 wipes come out together! Also as it is just water, it makes my baby’s skin wet and I need to dry it or wait for a minute before diaper her again to let her skin air dry. I used them for a long time and my baby has never had any issue or rash. Good product in general.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Not my preference but it works
customer_reviews.text: Not my go to wipes. With this chaos around the corona virus and everyone hoarding stuff I couldn't find my go to wipes anywhere. I saw these and I decided it was better than nothing. They are kind of hard to wipe everything without putting pressure down.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Parker

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLY thin & small!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO DISAPPOINTED! Lots of people rave about Eater Wipes, so my expectations were high. They are super thin & much smaller than other wipes. I have to fold it in half or use 2 in order to have a decent barrier between my hands & poop. They are also not very soft, so a little one with a sensitive bum cries in protest. I will not ever order these again. I've been shocked by how small & thin they are!
customer_reviews.author: Edward G Burford

customer_reviews.title: Totally gentle and work for just about everthing!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for 3 1/2 years now they are the best! for everything! I always keep one pack in the car! If they r to wet I just sqeeze it out a little. If they get to dry add a little water! Which only happens if the pack tears or something! They have no chemical taste or smell after you use them. perfect for washing hands, face, butts, everything! The cloth is soft and tough! These are my favorite by far! My child has never had a rash from these! Have not found anything close to these! closest thing to a real washrag and water.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Best Wipes Ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best wipes out there. We have 2 kids and have been buying these religiously since we discovered this brand. They’re 99% water and 1% grapefruit seed extract. It’s nice to find wipes that don’t contain a bunch of chemicals or ingredients. Our son has very sensitive skin and reacted badly to pampers and huggies wipes. But we have had zero issues with these! We even use them on their hands and face they’re so gentle. I highly recommend these to every parent. I believe these are the best wipes on the market!
customer_reviews.author: Kaleigh S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Wipes For Sensitive Skin
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has EXTREMELY sensitive skin and I was uncomfortable with her previous daycare provider using pampers wipes to wipe IN (yes in) and around her mouth after she'd spit up. She was getting bad diaper rashes and I was feeling uncomfortable about wiping her sore bottom with chemicals and perfume. Saw these at Toys R Us, decided to give them a try, and haven't went back. These are AMAZING. They are durable. They stay moist. Also, good for sensitive skin because they are essentially water and fruit juice. I use them to wipe her hands, face, and also use them to remove my makeup. Cannot say enough positive things about these wipes :)
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

product_meta.title: WaterWipes Unscented Baby Wipes, Sensitive and Newborn Skin, 9 Packs (540 Wipes)
product_meta.description: Size:540 CountWaterWipes Sensitive baby wipes are the world's purest baby wipes - 99.9% Water and a drop of fruit Extract. Suitable for newborns. Effective yet ultra-mild, pure, and gentle. WaterWipes are a suitable alternative to cotton wool and water and ideal for cleaning a baby's delicate skin. WaterWipes Unscented baby wipes for sensitive skin are fragrance free, and free of Alcohol, perfume, chlorine, formaldehyde, phenols, phthalates, SLS and SLES, lanolin and unnecessary additives. WaterWipes are unlike any other baby wipe on the market, and have been produced using cutting-edge new technology. When a baby is born, The outermost layer of their skin is inComplete, making their skin much thinner than adults. Conventional baby wipes use ingredients also found in bubble baths and shampoos. Thanks to WaterWipes, parents have the convenience of baby wipes with the absolute purity. With a clean, fresh non-greasy feel, they leave no residue on the skin.
feature_bullets: Simply two ingredients: Our fragrance-free baby wipes contain 99.9% water with just a drop of fruit extract

Ideal for sensitive skin: Waterwipes baby wipes are gentle enough for premature, infant, and newborn skin. Wipe material is a blend of 80% polyester and 20% viscose, which makes 20% of the wipe biodegradable
Simple & clean: Vegan society accredited baby wipes are hypoallergenic and contain no parabens or sulphates to irritate sensitive skin
Trusted: Waterwipes is awarded the national Eczema association of america seal of acceptance
Perfect for: Diaper changing, during weaning and teething, for cleaning baby's hands and face, and even adult sensitive skin care

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
